meanings.definition: (of a function) Having poles at isolated points in the complex plane.
meanings.sent1: The meromorphic function had poles at specific locations in the complex plane.
meanings.sent2: The mathematician studied the meromorphic properties of the function to understand its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The meromorphic function was like a game of hopscotch in the complex plane, jumping from pole to pole.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were meromorphic, scattered like poles in the vast landscape of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The meromorphic nature of the function made it resemble a constellation of poles in the mathematical sky.
